column4: remenic: i'm not particularly good with usb, but just to make sure you've checked this: it still works on other computers, right, it's not the hardware?
remenic: just think of how much you're learning ;)
heh, I'm learning I shouldn't have moved to ubuntu :P
it's the only thing I like over gentoo and archlinux though
in gentoo and archlinux I had a much more 'just works' feeling :/
yeah, package management is good in ubuntu
ah :) yeah, gentoo requires you to do more things manually
something I secretly like very much...
you might also want to check archlinux. The software repository leaves much to be desired, but it's a lot faster to install, and has a pretty good 'gentoo' feel :)
well, after rebooting everything works like it should
I think the problem can be reproduced by leaving the usb stick in it for a LONG time
yeah that's something that's always been difficult
